function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Underrepresentation of certain regions in the study","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Gender disparity in covid-19 knowledge","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low representation of women in the study may skew the results and impact the generalizability of findings.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High levels of misinformation about covid-19 among participants may lead to incorrect beliefs and behaviors regarding the disease.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overwhelming news exposure and reliance on tv and internet for information may impact participants’ understanding of covid-19 and influence their behaviors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low mean covid-19 prevention and mitigation knowledge in specific socio-demographic groups","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Gender differences in covid-19 knowledge scores","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of social networking apps for data collection and distribution.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large number of participants from all indonesian regions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Close contact during data collection using social networking apps.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete understanding of clinical features, signs, and symptoms of covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Misinformation and misconceptions about covid-19 transmission routes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistent practices for preventing and mitigating covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of a questionnaire adapted from another source may lead to cultural and contextual biases in the responses, impacting data quality and validity.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Using online methods to collect data during a stay-at-home regulation period.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Distributing the questionnaire through private and group channels in social networking apps.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Restricting participation to indonesian residents living overseas.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and knowledge among indonesian residents about covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate public attitudes and behavioral compliance towards disease prevention","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient sociodemographic data analysis for targeted intervention","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adequate knowledge and prevention practice related to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate health protocols and measures taken by the government","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Attention of countries focused on critical intervention for pandemic prevention and mitigation","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid global outbreak of covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of knowledge and attitude on covid-19 promotion and prevention","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Predicted increase in cases without vaccine availability","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate covid-19 testing capacity in the early days of the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Less predictable human activities due to behavioral changes related to modification of non-pharmaceutical interventions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential multicollinearity in mlr analysis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of public health impact in mobility simulation for activity data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of data on individual area of supermarkets and shopping malls","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Misrepresentation of human activity due to the use of simple aggregation measures based on zip code boundaries.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Low dcr leading to a temporary halt in case increase","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Social equity indicators and spatial differences","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Mobility patterns and behaviors during the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Urban density and crowding can lead to higher infection rates due to close proximity and increased interaction among individuals.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Commuting environments with high population density and close contact can facilitate the spread of pandemics through public transportation systems and shared commuting spaces.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Allocations of points of interest pois in a city can impact infection rates by influencing the movement and congregation of people in specific areas.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Evident inequalities in a city, such as disparities in access to healthcare, housing, and public services, can increase vulnerability to pandemics among disadvantaged populations.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for the density and spatial distribution of points of interest pois in pandemic-related research.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spatial disadvantages and inequality leading to disproportionate pandemic vulnerabilities.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for health equity in urban design and planning practice.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The perception that public transport is a major disseminator of viruses and has seeded epidemics in cities.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift in urban commute patterns away from public transit towards other modes of transportation , biking, walking, private vehicles .","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changes in urban activities and points of interest pois in response to pandemic risk and associated policies.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consensus on the effect of urban density on the spread of infectious diseases","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insignificance of population density on infection rate and negative effects on the spread of covid-19","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex temporal role of urban density in the spread of the virus","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High urban density and crowding may contribute to increased transmission of contagious diseases due to close proximity and frequent interaction among people.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited funding for multidisciplinary research in robotics and infectious diseases","category":"Society","confidence":"High"}]}
